author: JamesWTruher
body:
Fix the default path for finding the code coverage build to use `win7-x64` rather than `win10-x64`
Move the test results files to `$HOME/Documents` rather than `$PWD` which will remove the annoying `git status` showing these two files after getting code coverage. 
Change the default path for the coverage file for `Get-CodeCoverage` to be the location that `Invoke-OpenCover` uses.
Change the file coverage tool to take output from the GetFileCoverage Method. The earlier process was way to hard. Now you can type:
```powershell
$CodeCoverage = Get-CodeCoverage
$CodeCoverage.GetFileCoverage("Program.cs") | Format-FileCoverage
```
and see the lines covered and missed in any file named `Program.cs`
You can now compare coverage for a file between two runs with Compare-FileCoverage
```powershell
PS# compare-filecoverage $old $new program.cs

FileName   ReferenceCoverage DifferenceCoverage CoverageDelta
--------   ----------------- ------------------ -------------
Program.cs 100.00            100.00             0.00
```

comments.body: I'm looking for a quick turn around on this because I would like to use this update Thursday and Friday rather than requiring everyone use my fork.

title: Make it easier to view and compare code coverage for a file
